refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Given a real matrix A, unwrap(A, tol, dim) returns in a vector y the correction of A from all jumps greater than or equal to the default jump tolerance of π radians between two consecutive elements. If A is a matrix, unwrap operates columnwise. If A is a multidimensional array, unwrap operates on the first nonsingleton dimension.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: // Example n° 1: t = [0:.2:3, 3.5:1:10]; // Time values v = [0 -1.5728 -1.5747 -1.5772 -1.5790 -1.5816 -1.5852 -1.5877 -1.5922 .. -1.5976 -1.6044 -1.6129 -1.6269 -1.6512, -1.6998 -1.8621 1.7252 1.6124 .. 1.5930 1.5916 1.5708 1.5708 1.5708 ]; // Example vector clf subplot(2,1,1) plot(t, v); // Graph with original 'v' title("original profile") subplot(2,1,2) plot(t, [v' unwrap(v)']); // Graph with unwrapped ‘v’ title("The phase angle has been corrected, resulting in a 2.6959 jump") legend(["original" "unwrapped"])
